subject: Re: [junit] Re: Need some advices to solve 8Queens problem with TDD
msgSnippet: ... It reminds me of a similar question, two years ago in the XP list : If you need a sort, and you know bubble sort - almost - by heart, should you 1)  work
messageBody:
Dave Astels wrote:

>Why? There's well documented solutions. Look it up.
>

It reminds me of a similar question, two years ago in the XP list :
If you need a sort, and you know bubble sort - almost - by heart,
should you


1) work test first, 1 test at a time, and recreate the bubble sort,
step by step
or
2)
step 1 : write all the tests,
step 2 : write the bubble sort in one go, from memory,
step 3 : use the tests to fix off-by-1 errors.

I would use this later option, or its sibling where you switch step 1
and 2 (write the tests afterwards).

It just shows that the size of the steps depends on the developer's
experience, domain knowledge, and memory.


Alain Ravet
